00044 uint8_t menu1[] =
00045 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00046 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"

00057 // SSP Configuration structure variable
00058 SSP_CFG_Type SSP_ConfigStruct;
00059 //SSP Data setup structure variable
00060 SSP_DATA_SETUP_Type xferConfig;
00061 
00062 // Tx buffer
00063 uint8_t Tx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00064 // Rx buffer
00065 uint8_t Rx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00066 
00067 /* Status Flag indicates current SSP transmission complete or not */
00068 __IO FlagStatus complete;

00078 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00079 /*********************************************************************/
00084 void SSP0_IRQHandler(void)
00085 {
00086         SSP_DATA_SETUP_Type *xf_setup;
00087         uint16_t tmp;
00088         uint8_t dataword;
00089 
00090         // Disable interrupt
00091         SSP_IntConfig(LPC_SSP0, SSP_INTCFG_ROR|SSP_INTCFG_RT|SSP_INTCFG_RX|SSP_INTCFG_TX, DISABLE);
00092 
00093         if(SSP_GetDataSize(LPC_SSP0)>8)
00094                 dataword = 1;
00095         else
00096                 dataword = 0;
00097         xf_setup = &xferConfig;
00098         // save status
00099         tmp = SSP_GetRawIntStatusReg(LPC_SSP0);
00100         xf_setup->status = tmp;
00101 
00102         // Check overrun error
00103         if (tmp & SSP_RIS_ROR){
00104                 // Clear interrupt
00105                 SSP_ClearIntPending(LPC_SSP0, SSP_INTCLR_ROR);
00106                 // update status
00107                 xf_setup->status |= SSP_STAT_ERROR;
00108                 // Set Complete Flag
00109                 complete = SET;
00110                 return;
00111         }
00112 
00113         if ((xf_setup->tx_cnt != xf_setup->length) || (xf_setup->rx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00114                 /* check if RX FIFO contains data */
00115                 while ((SSP_GetStatus(LPC_SSP0, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY)) && (xf_setup->rx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00116                         // Read data from SSP data
00117                         tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(LPC_SSP0);
00118 
00119                         // Store data to destination
00120                         if (xf_setup->rx_data != NULL)
00121                         {
00122                                 if (dataword == 0){
00123                                         *(uint8_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->rx_data + xf_setup->rx_cnt) = (uint8_t) tmp;
00124                                 } else {
00125                                         *(uint16_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->rx_data + xf_setup->rx_cnt) = (uint16_t) tmp;
00126                                 }
00127                         }
00128                         // Increase counter
00129                         if (dataword == 0){
00130                                 xf_setup->rx_cnt++;
00131                         } else {
00132                                 xf_setup->rx_cnt += 2;
00133                         }
00134                 }
00135 
00136                 while ((SSP_GetStatus(LPC_SSP0, SSP_STAT_TXFIFO_NOTFULL)) && (xf_setup->tx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00137                         // Write data to buffer
00138                         if(xf_setup->tx_data == NULL){
00139                                 if (dataword == 0){
00140                                         SSP_SendData(LPC_SSP0, 0xFF);
00141                                         xf_setup->tx_cnt++;
00142                                 } else {
00143                                         SSP_SendData(LPC_SSP0, 0xFFFF);
00144                                         xf_setup->tx_cnt += 2;
00145                                 }
00146                         } else {
00147                                 if (dataword == 0){
00148                                         SSP_SendData(LPC_SSP0, (*(uint8_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->tx_data + xf_setup->tx_cnt)));
00149                                         xf_setup->tx_cnt++;
00150                                 } else {
00151                                         SSP_SendData(LPC_SSP0, (*(uint16_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->tx_data + xf_setup->tx_cnt)));
00152                                         xf_setup->tx_cnt += 2;
00153                                 }
00154                         }
00155 
00156                         // Check overrun error
00157                         if (SSP_GetRawIntStatus(LPC_SSP0, SSP_INTSTAT_RAW_ROR)){
00158                                 // update status
00159                                 xf_setup->status |= SSP_STAT_ERROR;
00160                                 // Set Complete Flag
00161                                 complete = SET;
00162                                 return;
00163                         }
00164 
00165                         // Check for any data available in RX FIFO
00166                         while ((SSP_GetStatus(LPC_SSP0, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY)) && (xf_setup->rx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00167                                 // Read data from SSP data
00168                                 tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(LPC_SSP0);
00169 
00170                                 // Store data to destination
00171                                 if (xf_setup->rx_data != NULL)
00172                                 {
00173                                         if (dataword == 0){
00174                                                 *(uint8_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->rx_data + xf_setup->rx_cnt) = (uint8_t) tmp;
00175                                         } else {
00176                                                 *(uint16_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->rx_data + xf_setup->rx_cnt) = (uint16_t) tmp;
00177                                         }
00178                                 }
00179                                 // Increase counter
00180                                 if (dataword == 0){
00181                                         xf_setup->rx_cnt++;
00182                                 } else {
00183                                         xf_setup->rx_cnt += 2;
00184                                 }
00185                         }
00186                 }
00187         }
00188 
00189         // If there more data to sent or receive
00190         if ((xf_setup->rx_cnt != xf_setup->length) || (xf_setup->tx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00191                 // Enable all interrupt
00192                 SSP_IntConfig(LPC_SSP0, SSP_INTCFG_ROR|SSP_INTCFG_RT|SSP_INTCFG_RX|SSP_INTCFG_TX, ENABLE);
00193         } else {
00194                 // Save status
00195                 xf_setup->status = SSP_STAT_DONE;
00196                 // Set Complete Flag
00197                 complete = SET;
00198         }
00199 }

00201 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00202 /*********************************************************************/
00207 void Buffer_Init(void)
00208 {
00209         uint8_t i;
00210 
00211         for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00212                 Tx_Buf[i] = i;
00213                 Rx_Buf[i] = 0;
00214         }
00215 }
00216 
00217 /*********************************************************************/
00222 void Error_Loop(void)
00223 {
00224         /* Loop forever */
00225         while (1);
00226 }
00227 
00228 /*********************************************************************/
00233 void Buffer_Verify(void)
00234 {
00235         uint8_t i;
00236         uint8_t *src_addr = (uint8_t *) &Tx_Buf[0];
00237         uint8_t *dest_addr = (uint8_t *) &Rx_Buf[0];
00238 
00239         for ( i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++ )
00240         {
00241                 if ( *src_addr++ != *dest_addr++ )
00242                 {
00243                         _DBG_("Verify error");
00244                         /* Call Error Loop */
00245                         Error_Loop();
00246                 }
00247         }
00248 }

00255 void print_menu(void)
00256 {
00257         _DBG(menu1);
00258 }
00259 
00260 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00261 /*********************************************************************/
00266 int c_entry(void)
00267 {
00268         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00269 
00270         /*
00271          * Initialize SPI pin connect
00272          * P0.15 - SCK;
00273          * P0.16 - SSEL
00274          * P0.17 - MISO
00275          * P0.18 - MOSI
00276          */
00277         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00278         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00279         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00280         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00281         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00282         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00283         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00284         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00285         PinCfg.Pinnum = 18;
00286         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00287         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00288         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00289 
00290         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00291          * – 115200bps
00292          * – 8 data bit
00293          * – No parity
00294          * – 1 stop bit
00295          * – No flow control
00296          */
00297         debug_frmwrk_init();
00298 
00299         // print welcome screen
00300         print_menu();
00301 
00302         // initialize SSP configuration structure to default
00303         SSP_ConfigStructInit(&SSP_ConfigStruct);
00304         SSP_ConfigStruct.Mode = SSP_SLAVE_MODE;
00305         // Initialize SSP peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00306         SSP_Init(LPC_SSP0, &SSP_ConfigStruct);
00307 
00308     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00309     NVIC_SetPriority(SSP0_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00310     /* Enable SSP0 interrupt */
00311     NVIC_EnableIRQ(SSP0_IRQn);
00312 
00313         // Enable SSP peripheral
00314         SSP_Cmd(LPC_SSP0, ENABLE);
00315 
00316         _DBG_("Init buffer");
00317         /* Initialize Buffer */
00318         Buffer_Init();
00319 
00320         _DBG_("Wait for master transfer...");
00321         complete = RESET;
00322         xferConfig.tx_data = Tx_Buf;
00323         xferConfig.rx_data = Rx_Buf;
00324         xferConfig.length = BUFFER_SIZE;
00325         SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT);
00326         while(complete == RESET);
00327 
00328         // Verify buffer after transferring
00329         Buffer_Verify();
00330         _DBG_("Verify complete!");
00331 
00332     /* Loop forever */
00333     while(1);
00334     return 1;
00335 }
00336 
00337 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00338    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00339    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00340    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00341    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00342 int main(void)
00343 {
00344     return c_entry();
00345 }

00355 *******************************************************************************/

00358         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00359          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00360

00362         while(1);
